::Prowl/FZ/Perndabot::

Prowl and FZ smash into the ground, both bots jumping up and back a 
few feet. They land on the ground, looking at each other, waiting for 
a strike.

-I'm doing ok,- Prowl replies, jumping back as FZ jumps at him. He 
recieves the image of Nemesis on the ground, stumbling back from a 
kick from FZ.

-Hey, the battle's not lost. As long as the Maximals live, we still 
have a chance,- he thinks to her, the world suddenly flashing as FZ's 
heel smashes into Prowl's head. Prowl stumbles to the side, his 
helmet dented. FZ jumps at him and brings him down.

The future self of the Alliance commander smiles as he stands up, 
dragging Prowl up with him. FZ's left hand was pressed to Prowl's 
forehead, holding the Maximal's head in place while his other hand 
held Prowl's arms. The orb in FZ's left hand flashes slightly.

Inside Prowl's mind, suggestions were being whispered from FZ's orb. 
It hinted at turning against the Maximals, whispered that it was a 
good idea, benificial. Prowl's mind fought against it, but the orb 
was stronger. It was, after all, a Vok artifact.

Images of Alliance victory fluttered through Prowl's mind, the orb 
trying to turn him against the Maximals. Maximal bodies were sprawled 
around the Cybertronian Fire, and Alliance troops were standing 
proudly in the background. Prowl's eyes looked through the bodies, 
seeing his and strangely feeling rather proud of it. Then his eyes 
stopped at one body, Iron Raptor...

Prowl yells, twisting out of FZ's grasp and jumping away from the 
bot. He spins around, growling.

"That's it," Prowl says. He didn't appreciate having his mind toyed 
with. His wrist plate slid aside, a pair of nunchucks flipping out. 
He put the two parts together, the string-like material that combined 
them pulling into the two halves. The halves extended and combined, 
making a glowing staff.

FZ jumps back as Prowl swings the staff toward him. The Alliance 
bot's mind was on other manners.

"I wouldn't stab down if I were you," he says over the comm to Iron 
Raptor. He'd seen the image she'd projected to Prowl while trying to 
influence Prowl's mind, "My troops are in position to destroy your 
base. Something like killing a second-in-command can really influence 
them to destroy."
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Perndabot jumps at Prowl as the energy blast hits him. He yells, 
falling to the ground and clutching at his chest, although every part 
of his body was burning with pain. He shudders, his armor beginning 
to melt.


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> Oops! Sorry about that. I never knew DarkWolf split.
> 
> * Iron Raptor growled from behind her helm as she watchjed the 
charge 
> Scattershot was sending interfere with her energy.
> Feeling the kickback as the energy of the explosion was sucked into 
the beam 
> only to make it stronger.
> The sword in her hands was almost burning hot, and she was sure 
that it 
> wouldn't be able to take the heat of this energy for too much 
longer.
> Her fingers were already cramping!
> Iron Raptor concintrated her thoughts and directed them to Prowl 
while she 
> kept the beam going.*
> < Prowl? How are you holding up?>

she looked

> Her scanners detecting that he was still awake but very near to 
stasis lock.
> Perhaps...it was time to finish him.

sure and

would pick

what she

enraged and

> < We've lost already. We lost the moment Oblitercon took shape.>

enemies

> She glared at the lump on the ground which was Nemisis Enforcer, 
walking up

Scattershots 
> charges struck her.
> Iron Raptor winced and grit her teeth, biting back the pain. Her 
eyes taking 
> a good look around her and seeing all of the carnage and battles.
> All of the mech-fluid and bodies.
> This was war. Real war.
> And she was sick of it!
> Iron Raptor retracted her helm, her hair falling out and down her 
back, her 
> head slowly turning towards Scattershot, not with a frown, but with 
a blank 
> expression.
> The beam had disappeared by now and the blade shimmered as she 
lowered the 
> tip of it down towards the crippled Nemisis, resting the tip just 
above his 
> spark cavity.
> Her free hand rested against her shoulder, mech-fluid leaking 
between her 
> fingers.*
> 
> " Scattershot...just how much do Alliance bots value their 
superiors? Not 
> much?"
> 
> * normal voice, the sword still just above Nemisis Enforcer's spark.
> Didn't really matter what his answer was, as soon as he gave her 
one that 
> sword would be through Nemisis's cavity and into his spark.
> But it was too bad that he wasn't part of a gustalt, then she would 
be 
> removing a vital limb and the gustalt wouldn't be able to form 
without,
